title: How to calculate the number of protons in the nucleus of an atom - Quora

response.answer_text: Number of protons is equal to the atomic number which is also equal to number of electrons. So if atomic number or number of electrons are known then number of protons can be ascertained
The number of protons in the nucleus is the atomic nber, which can vary from 1 (hydrogen) to 120 or so. Theoretically there's no limit.
